\chapter{Home}
\label{\detokenize{home:home}}\label{\detokenize{home::doc}}

\section{GothicHungarian: Searching for Gothic loanwords in Hungarian}
\label{\detokenize{home:gothichungarian-searching-for-gothic-loanwords-in-hungarian}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxhref{https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/}{\sphinxincludegraphics{{/home/viktor/Documents/GitHub/GothicHungarian/docs/doctrees/images/554312bbffabcb804cf4f8c50b1b75a140d3bd2b/by}.svg}} \sphinxhref{https://gothichungarian.readthedocs.io/en/latest/?badge=latest}{\sphinxincludegraphics{{/home/viktor/Documents/GitHub/GothicHungarian/docs/doctrees/images/2db0679317c6a84000bc4ea19b4bfa0b3e9032f2/025ffacba1a6361d680584c294bd2e2c31e65c66}.svg}} \sphinxhref{https://dl.circleci.com/status-badge/redirect/gh/LoanpyDataHub/GothicHungarian/tree/main}{\sphinxincludegraphics{{/home/viktor/Documents/GitHub/GothicHungarian/docs/doctrees/images/a955b4fe1c9cd3c3d1ba58e9093ab936479b78ae/main}.svg}}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Welcome to the GothicHungarian GitHub repository! This repository
contains Python scripts developed as part of my ongoing PhD thesis at
the University of Vienna. The repository is organised into three folders
containing Python scripts, raw data, and output data.


\subsection{Repository Structure}
\label{\detokenize{home:repository-structure}}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{setup.py}}: A setup file for installing the necessary packages and
dependencies.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{gothuncommands}}: A folder containing all the Python scripts for
data analysis.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{raw}}: A folder with raw data copied from two related repositories.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{out}}: A folder where the results go after running analyses with
the scripts.

\end{itemize}


\subsection{Related Repositories}
\label{\detokenize{home:related-repositories}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
The raw data in this repository is based on the following repositories:
\begin{enumerate}
\sphinxsetlistlabels{\arabic}{enumi}{enumii}{}{.}%
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxhref{https://github.com/LoanpyDataHub/gerstnerhungarian}{gerstnerhungarian}

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxhref{https://github.com/LoanpyDataHub/koeblergothic}{koeblergothic}

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxhref{https://github.com/LoanpyDataHub/ronataswestoldturkic}{ronataswestoldturkic}

\end{enumerate}

\sphinxAtStartPar
And much of the analysis is carried out with:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxhref{https://github.com/LoanpyDataHub/loanpy}{LoanPy}

\end{itemize}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Please visit these repositories for more information about the data
sources and their processing.


\subsection{License}
\label{\detokenize{home:license}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
This repository is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution (CC
BY 4.0) license. You are free to share and adapt the content, as long as
you give appropriate credit and indicate any changes made.


\subsection{Citation}
\label{\detokenize{home:citation}}
\sphinxhref{https://zenodo.org/badge/latestdoi/478210252}{\sphinxincludegraphics{{/home/viktor/Documents/GitHub/GothicHungarian/docs/doctrees/images/b8d69e37445f276bd46e1eb598b04c2b7f5ec815/478210252}.svg}}


\subsection{Installation and Usage}
\label{\detokenize{home:installation-and-usage}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
To replicate the results, follow the steps described in the
\sphinxhref{https://gothichungarian.readthedocs.io/en/latest/?badge=latest}{documentation}
and the \sphinxhref{https://loanpy.readthedocs.io/en/latest/tutorial.html}{loanpy
tutorial}


\subsection{Contributing}
\label{\detokenize{home:contributing}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
If you would like to contribute to the project, feel free to fork the
repository and submit a pull request with your changes. I appreciate
your collaboration! Also check out the \sphinxhref{https://github.com/LoanpyDataHub/GothicHungarian/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md}{Contribution Guidelines!}


\subsection{Contact}
\label{\detokenize{home:contact}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
If you have any questions or suggestions, please feel free to contact me
via \sphinxhref{mailto:viktor\_martinovic@\$removethis\$eva.mpg.de}{email} or
\sphinxhref{https://twitter.com/martino\_vik}{Twitter}.

\sphinxstepscope


\chapter{TL;DR}
\label{\detokenize{TL;DR:id1}}\label{\detokenize{TL;DR::doc}}\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{TL;DR:module-gothuncommands.__init__}}\index{module@\spxentry{module}!gothuncommands.\_\_init\_\_@\spxentry{gothuncommands.\_\_init\_\_}}\index{gothuncommands.\_\_init\_\_@\spxentry{gothuncommands.\_\_init\_\_}!module@\spxentry{module}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Preparation:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
python3\PYG{+w}{ }\PYGZhy{}m\PYG{+w}{ }venv\PYG{+w}{ }venv\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{o}{\PYGZam{}\PYGZam{}}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{n+nb}{source}\PYG{+w}{ }venv/bin/activate
git\PYG{+w}{ }clone\PYG{+w}{ }https://github.com/LoanpyDataHub/GothicHungarian.git
git\PYG{+w}{ }clone\PYG{+w}{ }https://github.com/LoanpyDataHub/gerstnerhungarian
git\PYG{+w}{ }clone\PYG{+w}{ }https://github.com/LoanpyDataHub/koeblergothic

pip\PYG{+w}{ }install\PYG{+w}{ }\PYGZhy{}e\PYG{+w}{ }GothicHungarian

python3\PYG{+w}{ }\PYGZhy{}m\PYG{+w}{ }spacy\PYG{+w}{ }download\PYG{+w}{ }de\PYGZus{}core\PYGZus{}news\PYGZus{}lg
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Analysis:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
loadinput
phonmatch
semmatch
loadcols
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\sphinxstepscope


\chapter{Create results}
\label{\detokenize{workflow:create-results}}\label{\detokenize{workflow::doc}}

\section{Step 1: Download and install this repository}
\label{\detokenize{workflow:step-1-download-and-install-this-repository}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Create and activate a virtual environment and clone this repository
(11.38 MB) by running

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
python3\PYG{+w}{ }\PYGZhy{}m\PYG{+w}{ }venv\PYG{+w}{ }venv\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{o}{\PYGZam{}\PYGZam{}}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{n+nb}{source}\PYG{+w}{ }venv/bin/activate
git\PYG{+w}{ }clone\PYG{+w}{ }https://github.com/LoanpyDataHub/GothicHungarian.git
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Next, clone the two repositories containing Hungarian and Gothic
language data (10.65 MB + 8.75 MB):

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
git\PYG{+w}{ }clone\PYG{+w}{ }https://github.com/LoanpyDataHub/gerstnerhungarian
git\PYG{+w}{ }clone\PYG{+w}{ }https://github.com/LoanpyDataHub/koeblergothic
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Next, from the same directory, run:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
pip\PYG{+w}{ }install\PYG{+w}{ }\PYGZhy{}e\PYG{+w}{ }GothicHungarian
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\sphinxAtStartPar
This will install a command\sphinxhyphen{}line interface for running the analysis.
It will also install two dependencies, namely \sphinxhref{https://pypi.org/project/loanpy/}{loanpy} and
\sphinxhref{https://pypi.org/project/spacy/}{Spacy}, for which we need to install
a pretrained German word\sphinxhyphen{}vector model. You can find different
models on the \sphinxhref{https://spacy.io/models/de/}{Spacy website}. Currently
this 500 MB model seems to be the most suiting (But make sure to use the same
model as in \sphinxhref{https://github.com/LoanpyDataHub/gerstnerhungarian}{gerstnerhungarian}
and \sphinxhref{https://github.com/LoanpyDataHub/koeblergothic}{koeblergothic}
because entries in those repositories were filtered out if they were missing
from this particular word\sphinxhyphen{}vector model):

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
python3\PYG{+w}{ }\PYGZhy{}m\PYG{+w}{ }spacy\PYG{+w}{ }download\PYG{+w}{ }de\PYGZus{}core\PYGZus{}news\PYGZus{}lg
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\sphinxAtStartPar
To deactivate the virtual environment run:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
deactivate
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\sphinxAtStartPar
and to remove it run:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
rm\PYG{+w}{ }\PYGZhy{}r\PYG{+w}{ }venv
\end{sphinxVerbatim}


\section{Step 2: Load the relevant data in the right format}
\label{\detokenize{workflow:step-2-load-the-relevant-data-in-the-right-format}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
From your command\sphinxhyphen{}line, run

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
loadinput
\end{sphinxVerbatim}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{workflow:module-gothuncommands.loadinput}}\index{module@\spxentry{module}!gothuncommands.loadinput@\spxentry{gothuncommands.loadinput}}\index{gothuncommands.loadinput@\spxentry{gothuncommands.loadinput}!module@\spxentry{module}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Load and transform input data for loanfinder, save to \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{raw}} folder.
\index{main() (in module gothuncommands.loadinput)@\spxentry{main()}\spxextra{in module gothuncommands.loadinput}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{workflow:gothuncommands.loadinput.main}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{gothuncommands.loadinput.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{main}}}{}{}
\pysigstopsignatures\begin{enumerate}
\sphinxsetlistlabels{\arabic}{enumi}{enumii}{}{.}%
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Read the filenames with the argparse library

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Assign the file contents to variables

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Create four dictionaries from them for later use

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Create input for \sphinxhref{https://loanpy.readthedocs.io/en/latest/documentation.html\#loanpy.loanfinder.phonetic\_matches}{loanpy.loanfinder.phonetic\_matches}.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Write files to \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{raw}} folder.

\end{enumerate}

\end{fulllineitems}



\section{Step 3: Search for phonetic matches}
\label{\detokenize{workflow:step-3-search-for-phonetic-matches}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
From your command\sphinxhyphen{}line, run

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
phonmatch
\end{sphinxVerbatim}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{workflow:module-gothuncommands.phonmatch}}\index{module@\spxentry{module}!gothuncommands.phonmatch@\spxentry{gothuncommands.phonmatch}}\index{gothuncommands.phonmatch@\spxentry{gothuncommands.phonmatch}!module@\spxentry{module}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Read the prepared input files in folder \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{raw}} and search for phonetic
matches between Gothic and Hungarian. Write result as \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{phonetic\_matches.tsv}}
to folder \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{out}}.
\index{main() (in module gothuncommands.phonmatch)@\spxentry{main()}\spxextra{in module gothuncommands.phonmatch}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{workflow:gothuncommands.phonmatch.main}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{gothuncommands.phonmatch.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{main}}}{}{}
\pysigstopsignatures\begin{enumerate}
\sphinxsetlistlabels{\arabic}{enumi}{enumii}{}{.}%
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Import \sphinxhref{https://loanpy.readthedocs.io/en/latest/documentation.html\#loanpy.loanfinder.phonetic\_matches}{loanpy.loanfinder.phonetic\_matches}

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Read the input data

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Pass it on to loanpy

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
End the function since loanpy writes the file

\end{enumerate}

\end{fulllineitems}



\section{Step 4: Search for semantic matches}
\label{\detokenize{workflow:step-4-search-for-semantic-matches}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
From your command\sphinxhyphen{}line, run

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
semmatch
\end{sphinxVerbatim}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{workflow:module-gothuncommands.semmatch}}\index{module@\spxentry{module}!gothuncommands.semmatch@\spxentry{gothuncommands.semmatch}}\index{gothuncommands.semmatch@\spxentry{gothuncommands.semmatch}!module@\spxentry{module}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Read the phonetic matches file in folder \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{out}} and search for
semantic matches among them. Write results as \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{semantic\_matches.tsv}}
to folder \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{out}}.
\index{main() (in module gothuncommands.semmatch)@\spxentry{main()}\spxextra{in module gothuncommands.semmatch}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{workflow:gothuncommands.semmatch.main}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{gothuncommands.semmatch.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{main}}}{}{}
\pysigstopsignatures\begin{enumerate}
\sphinxsetlistlabels{\arabic}{enumi}{enumii}{}{.}%
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Import \sphinxhref{https://loanpy.readthedocs.io/en/latest/documentation.html\#loanpy.loanfinder.semantic\_matches}{loanpy.loanfinder.semantic\_matches}

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Read phonetic matches file with csv library

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Read related tables that contain the meanings

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Grab meanings from related tables and create new input table

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Input the table to loanpy.loanfinder.semantic\_matches
\textless{}\sphinxurl{https://loanpy.readthedocs.io/en/latest/documentation.html\#loanpy.loanfinder.semantic\_matches}\textgreater{}\textasciigrave{}\_

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
End the function since loanpy writes the file

\end{enumerate}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{semsim() (in module gothuncommands.semmatch)@\spxentry{semsim()}\spxextra{in module gothuncommands.semmatch}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{workflow:gothuncommands.semmatch.semsim}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{gothuncommands.semmatch.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{semsim}}}{\sphinxparam{\DUrole{n,n}{meaning1}}, \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n,n}{meaning2}}}{}
\pysigstopsignatures\begin{enumerate}
\sphinxsetlistlabels{\arabic}{enumi}{enumii}{}{.}%
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Convert each meaning to a Spacy\sphinxhyphen{}object

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Create cartesian product of both meaning lists with a
nested for\sphinxhyphen{}loop

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Return the similarity of the most similar pair

\end{enumerate}

\end{fulllineitems}



\section{Step 5: Load columns for manual inspection}
\label{\detokenize{workflow:step-5-load-columns-for-manual-inspection}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
From your command\sphinxhyphen{}line, run

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
loadcols
\end{sphinxVerbatim}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{workflow:module-gothuncommands.loadcols}}\index{module@\spxentry{module}!gothuncommands.loadcols@\spxentry{gothuncommands.loadcols}}\index{gothuncommands.loadcols@\spxentry{gothuncommands.loadcols}!module@\spxentry{module}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Merge IDs in \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{out/semantic\_matches.tsv}} with relevant columns for manual
inspection.
\index{main() (in module gothuncommands.loadcols)@\spxentry{main()}\spxextra{in module gothuncommands.loadcols}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{workflow:gothuncommands.loadcols.main}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{gothuncommands.loadcols.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{main}}}{}{}
\pysigstopsignatures\begin{enumerate}
\sphinxsetlistlabels{\arabic}{enumi}{enumii}{}{.}%
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Read the semantic matches file

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Read the related tables

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Stitch the desired columns together

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Overwrite the input file

\end{enumerate}

\end{fulllineitems}



\section{Step 6: Manually inspect the results}
\label{\detokenize{workflow:step-6-manually-inspect-the-results}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Open the file in a spread\sphinxhyphen{}sheet software, sort the rows according to
semantic similarity (column \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{semsim}}) and within that according to
cognate ID (column \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{ID\_s}}). Carefully look at the matches:
Pick candidate loanwords where the phonetic matching and the semantic shift
looks plausible.
